comment: I've remained a committed Spotify user for quite a while, but the recent updates have had a notable negative impact on my overall experience. The inability to choose specific sections of a song and the absence of a "go back" option for previous tracks are genuinely frustrating. It seems like they've removed essential features and introduced unnecessary ones that users never asked for. I'm actively contemplating switching to an alternative platform if these problems aren't resolved promptly.
scenarios: Inability to choose specific sections of a song.
Absence of a "go back" option for previous tracks.
key sentence: Absence of a "go back" option for previous tracks.
the function of activity: The activity involves searching for contacts, opening menus, initiating playback, controlling playback, managing playlists, sharing tracks, adjusting volume, and connecting to devices.
the sub-task list of state: [{'name': 'Add songs', 'description': 'Add a song to liked playlist or other playlist'}, {'name': 'Close', 'description': 'Close the current window or menu'}, {'name': 'More options', 'description': 'Access additional options for a selected item'}, {'name': 'Play', 'description': 'Start playing the selected content'}, {'name': 'Next track', 'description': 'Skip to the next track or item'}, {'name': 'Previous track', 'description': 'Go back to the previous track or item'}, {'name': 'Share', 'description': 'Share the current content with others'}]
